joevy6: My daughter just finished chemo a month ago, for ovarian cancer (she’s 29 year old). I will show her this posting, as I know what you wrote will definitely be something she can relate to, and appreciate. Thank you for your honesty. Cancer has changed a lot of things for her, some that she wishes it never did, (like losing her hair.- because it, too, was her “identity”), but cancer also gave her so much - she worries less, and enjoys life more. She knows that life can change just like that, so she enjoys every moment, every day, and she takes nothing for granted. Cancer tried to stop her, but it didn’t, it actually fuelled a fire within her, and she’s unstoppable now. Again, thank you for this posting - It means a lot to me, and I’m sure many, many others.
